items.sentence: I\'ve forgotten the names of Tom\'s sisters.
I\'ve found something I\'d like to show you.
Tom told Mary she shouldn\'t do that inside.
Tom told everyone that I didn\'t want to go.
Tom told me he didn\'t like speaking French.
Tom told me he didn\'t want to study French.
My grandfather died in the Second World War.
My opinion is a little different from yours.
My wife and I always eat breakfast together.
Tom told me he wasn\'t going to wait for us.
Tom told me that I shouldn\'t be doing this.
Tom could smell the wet dog across the room.
Tom won\'t leave until he\'s talked to Mary.
I have something I have to discuss with Tom.
I heard that Tom and Mary got back together.
I need a pair of scissors to cut this paper.
Mary picked a flower and put it in her hair.
Mary wanted to know if Tom had a girlfriend.
Most people around here have no electricity.
My father could swim well when he was young.
I use flashcards to study French vocabulary.
I used to think Tom was a pretty good coach.
We need to stop Tom before he hurts himself.
Were you at the library yesterday afternoon?
What are you going to do tomorrow afternoon?
I hope to hire someone who can speak French.
Give us a call as soon as you get to Boston.
Has anything like this ever happened before?
Have I said something to hurt your feelings?
Have a listen and let me know your thoughts.
You don\'t look like you\'re having any fun.
I could tell he was only pretending to read.
I got some shampoo in my eyes and it stings.
I played chess with Tom yesterday afternoon.
That\'s the silliest thing I\'ve ever heard.
That\'s the strangest thing I\'ve ever seen.
That\'s the ugliest snowman I\'ve ever seen.
That\'s what you told Tom, I\'m pretty sure.
I can pay you more if that\'s what you want.
I can\'t get excited about anything anymore.
I can\'t open the door. Do you have the key?
I can\'t pay you back the money you lent me.
I didn\'t know Tom had a contagious disease.
I didn\'t think you\'d want to see me again.
I don\'t even know what Tom\'s real name is.
Tom put a star on top of the Christmas tree.
Tom put salt in his coffee instead of sugar.
Tom read anything he could lay his hands on.
Tom really wanted to go to Boston with Mary.
I doubt that Tom knows Mary\'s phone number.
